Kevin Lawrence wrote:

> On 8/17/06, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@... 
> <mailto:jbrains%40rogers.com>> wrote:
>  >
>  > I think it's easy. Start with "fewer lines of code" as a measure of
>  > simplicity. When you get to the first counterexample, add the next
>  > ingredient...
> 
> Wouldn't it be simpler to start with "no duplication" as a measure of
> simplicity?

Ron Jeffries tells a story of watching Kent Beck analyze two blocks of 
seemingly different code, changing them so that they were obviously 
duplicated, then removing the duplication. I imagine Ron wouldn't tell 
this story if Kent hadn't impressed him by spotting that duplication. I 
further imagine that Ron wouldn't have been impressed if the duplication 
were easy to describe and understand, but anyone can count lines of 
code--even a computer.

Take care.
--
